descriptor.name: Livestock Health & Diseases Control (LHDC) Program Advisor
descriptor.short_desc: Equip yourself to advise farmers on accessing national veterinary services and vaccination programs under the LHDC scheme.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This course covers the centrally sponsored 'Livestock Health and Diseases Control' (LHDC) scheme. Agents will learn about the national strategy to control and eradicate animal diseases, provide doorstep veterinary services, and guide livestock owners through the application process for these benefits.

  1. Disease Control Programs:
    Understand the objectives of critical initiatives like the Peste des Petits Ruminants Eradication Programme (PPR-EP) and the Classical Swine Fever Control Programme (CSF-CP).
  2. Accessing Veterinary Services:
    Learn how farmers can access veterinary services at their doorstep through Mobile Veterinary Units (MVUs) and how to engage with local veterinary offices for prophylactic vaccinations.
  3. Application & Eligibility:
    Master the offline application process, including the required documents like Aadhaar and livestock ownership proofs, to help bona fide farmers receive scheme benefits.

Why Take This Course:

  • Play a crucial role in improving national food security and animal health.
  • Reduce economic losses for farmers by connecting them with vital government healthcare services.
  • Become a trusted advisor for rural communities dependent on livestock for their livelihood.

descriptor.name: National Animal Health Training Authority
descriptor.short_desc: Dedicated to training personnel on central government schemes for livestock health and disease prevention.
descriptor.long_desc: The National Animal Health Training Authority is committed to strengthening India's veterinary infrastructure by disseminating knowledge about critical disease control programs.
